endemo2.model_instance.model.industry package

Submodules

endemo2.model_instance.model.industry.industry_sector module

class Industry(country_name, industry_instance_filter, product_instance_filter)[source]

Bases: Sector

The Industry class represents the industry sector of one country. It holds all products produced by this industry.

Variables:

  • _country_name (str) – Name of the country this industry is located in.

  • _products (dict[str, Product]) – All products in this industry.

Parameters:

  • industry_instance_filter (IndustryInstanceFilter) –

  • product_instance_filter (ProductInstanceFilter) –

calculate_forecasted_demand()[source]

Sums over the forecasted demand of each product.

Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand summed over all products in this industry.

calculate_forecasted_demand_distributed_by_nuts2()[source]

Calls the calculate_demand_split_by_nuts2 function and sums over all products.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The dictionary of {nuts2_region -> demand}.

calculate_forecasted_hourly_demand()[source]

Calculate the hourly demand for this industry.

Return type:

dict[DemandType, [<class ‘float’>]]

Returns:

The hourly demand in a list in order by demand type.

calculate_forecasted_hourly_demand_distributed_by_nuts2()[source]

Calculate the hourly demand for this industry distributed by NUTS2 regions.

Return type:

dict[str, dict[DemandType, [<class ‘float’>]]]

Returns:

The hourly demand in a list in order by demand type.

calculate_rest_demand_distributed_by_nuts2()[source]

Calls the calculate_rest_sector_demand function and splits the result according to capacity for each NUTS2 region.

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The dictionary of {nuts2_region -> demand}.

calculate_rest_sector_demand()[source]

Calculate the rest sector demand for a certain year.

\[\begin{split}rest_{\text{start_year}}[TWh]=perc_{\text{start_year}}*demand_{\text{start_year}}[TWh]\\ rest(y)[TWh] = rest_{\text{start_year}}[TWh]*(1+r)^{y-\text{start_year}}\end{split}\]
Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The demand of the rest sector in given year rest(y).

calculate_rest_sector_hourly_demand()[source]

Calculate the hourly demand for the rest sector of this industry.

Return type:

dict[DemandType, [<class ‘float’>]]

Returns:

The hourly demand in a list in order by demand type.

Return type:

dict[str, dict[DemandType, [<class ‘float’>]]]

Returns:

The hourly demand in a list in order by demand type.

endemo2.model_instance.model.industry.products module

class Product(country_name, product_name, product_instance_filter, is_empty=False)[source]

Bases: object

The class that represents a industry subsector in the model.

calculate_demand()[source]

Calculates the demand for this product. Returns zero demand when the _empty attribute is true.

\[D(y)[TWh/T] = p*A(y)[T]*(c_{electricity}, c_{heat_{split}}, c_{hydrogen})[TWh/T]\]
Return type:

Demand

Returns:

The calculated demand.

calculate_hourly_demand()[source]

Calculate the hourly demand for this product.

Return type:

dict[DemandType, [<class ‘float’>]]

Returns:

The hourly demand in a list in order by demand type.

calculate_hourly_demand_distributed_by_nuts2()[source]

Calculate the hourly demand for this product distributed to nuts2 regions.

Return type:

dict[str, dict[DemandType, [<class ‘float’>]]]

Returns:

The hourly demand in a list in order by demand type for every nuts2 region.

get_demand_distributed_by_nuts2()[source]

Calculated demand and distributes result according to installed capacities of nuts2

Return type:

dict[str, Demand]

Returns:

The demand distributed by nuts2 regions as a dictionary {region_name -> region_demand}

Module contents

This package holds all modules that are only relevant for the industry sector.
